etymologies: 1950s: from the perceived resemblance to the sizzling sound produced when food is fried

definitions: a way of speaking in which the voice is very low-pitched and has a characteristic rough or creaking sound

examples.text: she tweaks the way teen girls actually talk, with high-rising terminals, vocal fry, and ‘like’ for emphasis
his girlfriend uses uptalk and vocal fry

shortDefinitions: way of speaking in which voice is low-pitched and has creaking sound
